page.title: 04LANDSCAPE_ MONEYPOT HILL
page.content: Moneypot hill is mostly all wooded.The south_west corner is covered by Beckerings Park Moor.The{A418}also runs through the woodland and goes up to Millbrook.The woodland is made up mostly of Scots Pine (coniferous) but there are some deciduous trees like Oak,Beech,Sycamore and Lime.To the west of the hill there is a house {"Blackhafields cottage"}this was built in 1843 and the occupant has lived there for 16 years.The wood is owned by the{Duke of Bedford}and the cottage used to be lived in by the gamekeeper. There is a copse to the north of the cottage where the gamekeeper used to chop wood for his fire.There is lots of wildlife in the woods there are Muntjak deer.There are quite a lot of footpaths and it is a very nice wood. The plantation was built in 1966.
